title: GlobalCoffeeDataset
description: This schema displays the initial basic Indicators for farm-level coffee sustainability, as originally determined by the GCP and the SPF Indicator Working Group. COSA--with feedback from the members of the Global Expert Committee--developed and synthesized practical metrics to operationalize the indicators so they can be functional across origins and comparable over time. The approach builds on global experience refined with tens of thousands of surveys and the expertise of the Committee members.

propertyNames.description: Property names must be in lower CamelCase

globalCoffeeDatasetId.description: The unique identifier for a dataset

schemaVersion.description: The version number of the schema. When not provided the latest version of the schema will be used to validate the dataset

dateTimeSend.description: The date and time this dataset was send. This SHOULD be a date in ISO 8601 format of YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ in UTC time.

sender.description: The name of the organisation that send this dataset

farmerId.title: Globally Unique ID of the farmer
farmerId.description: Globally Unique ID of the recording of the farmer at a specific time and by a specific organisation.

name.title: First and last name(s) of the farmer surveyed
name.description: First and last name(s) of the farmer surveyed. Initials should be avoided when possible. In places where farmers use only one name (a family name), that name should be entered as the Last Name and an appropriate prefix or 'Farmer' could be entered as the First Name.

firstName.title: First name(s) of the farmer surveyed
firstName.description: First name(s) of the farmer surveyed. In places where farmers use only one name (a family name), that name should be entered as the Last Name and an appropriate prefix or 'Farmer' could be entered as the First Name.

lastName.title: Last name of the farmer surveyed
lastName.description: Last name of the farmer surveyed. Initials should be avoided when possible. In places where farmers use only one name (a family name), that name should be entered as the Last Name and an appropriate prefix or 'Farmer' could be entered as the First Name.

address.title: The address of the farm
address.description: An address. This is the legally registered address of the farmer.

dateOfBirth.title: Date of birth.
dateOfBirth.description: Either date of birth or Age is required. For example 2016-08-17. Data point used to understand relative presence of youth and calculate youth engagement: % of producers in the sustainability program or supply chain 35 years old and under

age.title: Age of the farmer
age.description: Either Age or Date of birth is required. Data point used to understand relative presence of youth and calculate youth engagement: % of producers in the sustainability program or supply chain 35 years old and under

gender.title: Gender
gender.description: Data point used to understand relative presence of women and to calculate women's engagement and the outcomes they experience as diverse from men: % of women in the sustainability program or supply chain

farmIds.title: Farm Ids
farmIds.description: Which farms belong to this farmer. At least one is required.

thirdPartyIds.title: Third party identifier
thirdPartyIds.description: When this dataset is reused by another organization that needs to use their own Global Unique Identifier, the original identifier can be saved here, to track history and origin.

povertyLevel.title: Poverty level
povertyLevel.description: Comparison of total household revenue to International (World Bank) Poverty Line (total divided by # adult individuals in hh)

schoolAgeHouseholdMembers.description: % of school-age household members, under age 18, who have completed appropriate grade level for their age

hazardousProhibition.description: Are young workers (those under age 18) working in hazardous conditions (applying chemical pesticides, using hazardous machinery, moving excessive weights/loads, etc.)

hunger.title: Hunger days
hunger.description: Number of days in past year that any member of household cut food consumption due to lack of food.

farmId.title: Farm Id
farmId.description: Globally Unique ID of the recording of the farm at a specific time and by a specific organisation.

farmerId.title: Farmer Id
farmerId.description: Globally Unique ID of the farmer of this farm

frontDoor.title: Front door geolocation
frontDoor.description: GPS should be captured for each farm plot if possible. GPS readings should be taken outside of buildings and away from significant tree coverage to avoid interference in the signal. GPS should be captured in the middle of the plot, and/or near the entrance to any main building (if there is one). Where the main residence or other buildings are not located on the farm plot, GPS should be taken in the middle of the plot.

address.title: Farm address
address.description: This should be the location of the farm itself (main plot), not the home of the farmer, if different.

totalFarmSize.title: Total farm size (ha)
totalFarmSize.description: Total Farm size refers to total property size, including land used to grow crops, pasture, wooded areas, land covered by buildings, and any other area included in the property. Best practice is to collect response in any given unit, and then perform conversion to a standard international unit (ha). Data validation should ensure that the total area planted in coffee should be less than the total farm size. It is ok to rely on farmer recall although more rigorous estimates will include GPS or polygonal mapping data. Consider that farms may contain multiple plots (plots are farm land areas that are not connected, or farm areas that are managed differently, or both). Make sure to add all relevant plots managed by members of a household together (that is, the farm area should coincide with the land used to account for the farm cost and revenue data being reported).

totalAreaCoffee.title: Total Area planted in Coffee (ha)
totalAreaCoffee.description: Area under coffee production can also be triangulated with other pieces of data collected (e.g., trees planted per unit land (density rate) and/or total number of trees planted).

thirdPartyIds.title: Third party identifier
thirdPartyIds.description: When this dataset is reused by another organization that needs to use their own Global Unique Identifier, the original identifier can be saved here, to track history and origin.

laborPractices.title: Labor Practices
laborPractices.description: % of good labor practices adopted (of those listed)

wages.title: Wages
wages.description: Daily average earnings for farm labor compared to (rural) minimum wage. Wage is listed and also expressed as a percentage of the rural minimum wage (where that exists), alternately to the national minimum wage.

coffeeProfit.title: Coffee Profit
coffeeProfit.description: Total revenue from coffee sales minus total costs for coffee production (Reported in USD/ha of coffee productive area.)

productivity.title: Yield / Productivity
productivity.description: kgs of GBE (harvested)/ha of coffee productive area

productionCosts.title: Cost of Production
productionCosts.description: Costs incurred to produce the coffee during the last production year (calculated per kg of GBE)

price.title: Price - Chain efficiency & returns distribution
price.description: Average Price received per kg of coffee (GBE)

sustainablePurchases.title: Sustainable purchases
sustainablePurchases.description: Volume of sustainable purchases by buyer and as a proportion of total, and change year to year.

areaConvertedLand.description: Land area (in ha) and proportion of the farm that was converted from natural land (e.g.,, forest, savanna) to land used for coffee production in the last 5 years.

ecosystemProtection.description: % of forest and ecosystem protection practices used on the farm

fertilizerUse.title: Fertilizer use
fertilizerUse.description: Whether a professional assessment or advice was used to determine fertilizer needs on the farm. It does not require in-depth fertilizer information: nutrient amounts, local commercial names, dosage amounts, application rates, etc.

waterConservation.description: % of applicable water conservation practices used on the farm (of those listed)

waterContamination.description: % of water contamination prevention practices used on the farm (of those listed).

ipmPractices.title: % of IPM practices employed on the farm
ipmPractices.description: • Conduct regular visual examinations of the coffee to detect pests and/or diseases • Use traps, repellents, and natural pesticides • Create or preserve places (including plant species) for beneficial predators of pests to live • Maintain written record of pest infestation, treatments, and results • Plant or preserve species that repel pests of the coffee • Apply pesticide or kill pests only after identifying the pest and only at the best time in the pest’s life cycle to permanently reduce its population

useOfBannedPesticides.title: Use of banned or hazardous pesticides on the farm
useOfBannedPesticides.description:
Banned or hazardous pesticides* will be based of the WHO Ia and Ib lists. COSA suggests that over time it will be useful to understand the types and/ or individual banned pesticides being used so that research bodies can develop varietals or take other actions that help prevent the need for their use in the field. This approach does not address proper disposal of pesticide containers. 
*Pesticides include insecticides, fungicides, rodenticides, nematicides and herbicides.

soilConservation.title: Soil Conservation
soilConservation.description: % of applicable soil conservation practices used on the farm (of those listed)
